subdefinitions.definition: Used with past participles of verbs to form the passive voice .
examples: The dog was saved by the boy.

subdefinitions.definition: Used with present participles of verbs to form the continuous aspect .
examples: The woman is walking.
I shall be writing to you soon.
We liked to chat while we were eating.

subdefinitions.definition: Used with to -infinitives of verbs to express intent, obligation, appropriateness , or relative future occurrence.
examples: I am to leave tomorrow.
They are to stay here until I return.
I'd been to've been ambassador, but fell seriously ill.
How were they to know the whole exercise was a ruse?
They were to have been married overseas but COVID forced a change of plans.

subdefinitions.definition: Used with past participles of certain intransitive verbs to form the perfect aspect .
examples: He is finished .
He is gone .
He is come .

subdefinitions.definition: To tend to do, often do; marks the habitual aspect .
subdefinitions.label_groups: African-American Vernacular , Caribbean , Ireland , auxiliary , not conjugated

subdefinitions.definition: To exist .
examples: There is just one woman in town who can help us.
( or, dialectally: ) It is just one woman in town who can help us.
subdefinitions.label_groups: with there , or dialectally it , as dummy subject

subdefinitions.definition: Used to declare the subject and object identical or equivalent.
examples: Hi, I ’m Jim.
3 times 5 is fifteen.
These four are the ones going to the quarter-finals.
François Mitterrand was president of France from 1981 to 1995.
This is how we do it.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate that a predicate nominal applies to the subject.
examples: Rex is a dog.
A dog is an animal.
Dogs are animals.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate that the subject has the qualities described by an adjective or prepositional phrase.
examples: The sky is blue.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate that the subject has the qualities described by a noun or noun phrase.
examples: The sky is a deep blue today.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to link a subject to a measurement .
examples: This building is three hundred years old.
I am 75 kilograms.
He ’s about 6 feet tall.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to state the age of a subject in years.
examples: I ’m 20 (years old).

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate the time of day.
examples: It is almost eight (o’clock).
It ’s 8:30 [read eight-thirty ] in Tokyo.
[read
What time is it there? It ’s night.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate passage of time since the occurrence of an event .
examples: It has been three years since my grandmother died. (similar to "My grandmother died three years ago", but emphasizes the intervening period)
It had been six days since his departure, when I received a letter from him.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to link two noun clauses: a day of the week, recurring date, month, or other specific time (on which the event of the main clause took place) and a period of time indicating how long ago that day was.
examples: I saw her Monday was a week: I saw her a week ago last Monday (a week before last Monday).
On the morning of Sunday was fortnight before Christmas: on the morning of the Sunday that was two weeks before the Sunday prior to Christmas.
subdefinitions.label_groups: rare and regional , chiefly in the past tense

subdefinitions.definition: To pass or spend (time).
To take a period of time.
examples: Dinner will be ten minutes.
It was an hour before he returned.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to indicate ambient conditions such as weather , light , noise or air quality .
examples: It is hot in Arizona, but it is not usually humid.
Why is it so dark in here?
labels: with it as a dummy subject
subdefinitions.label_groups: often impersonal , with it as a dummy subject

subdefinitions.definition: To exist or behave in a certain way.
examples: "What do we do?" "We be ourselves."
Just be yourself.
Why is he being nice to me?
labels: conjugated non-suppletively in the present tense
subdefinitions.label_groups: dynamic / lexical be , especially in progressive tenses , conjugated non-suppletively in the present tense , see usage notes

subdefinitions.definition: To exist ; to have real existence, to be alive.
examples: The Universe has no explanation: it just is .
That was the week that was .
This is something that was meant to be .

subdefinitions.definition: To remain undisturbed in a certain state or situation.
examples: Let them be for a few hours.
Leave us be until the guests arrive.

subdefinitions.definition: To occupy a place .
examples: The cup is on the table.

subdefinitions.definition: To occur , to take place.
examples: When will the meeting be ?

subdefinitions.definition: Elliptical form of "be here", "go to and return from" or similar, also extending to certain other senses of "go".
examples: The postman has been today, but my tickets have still not yet come.
I have been to Spain many times.
We've been about twenty miles.
I have terrible constipation – I haven't been for several days.
I’ve been into town this morning.
